revised_title: Experimental Study of Vortex Boundary Layers and Flow Visualization
tldr: This study investigates the behavior of vortex boundary layers beneath a Rankine-like vortex rotating normal to a stationary horizontal disc. The researchers used flow visualization techniques to observe the effects of Reynolds numbers on the boundary layer. They found that the boundary layer remains laminar below a Reynolds number of about 10^5 and becomes turbulent with further increases in Reynolds numbers. The flow relaminarizes as it is advected radially inward by the radial pressure gradient associated with the outer flow.
